body_html:
What's the perspective for having Magma-functions in ATen native? I realize that there is quite a bit of code, but having each (ATen visible) function in its own file seems like a lot of clutter if we eventually do this for all of THCTensorMathMagma.
On a related note, if we keep the templated function in an anonymous namespace, maybe we can avoid splitting it out as much (with the erroring default etc.).
Just a thought, though, as I'm thinking about whether batched potrf will also resolve the complaints about potrf speed.

body:
What's the perspective for having Magma-functions in ATen native? I realize that there is quite a bit of code, but having each (ATen visible) function in its own file seems like a lot of clutter if we eventually do this for all of THCTensorMathMagma.
On a related note, if we keep the templated function in an anonymous namespace, maybe we can avoid splitting it out as much (with the erroring default etc.).
Just a thought, though, as I'm thinking about whether batched potrf will also resolve the complaints about potrf speed.
